intro: Leontodon protheiformis subsp. incanus, commonly known as the white leontodon, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and rocky soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The subspecies incanus is distinguished by its slightly hairy leaves and a more compact growth habit compared to other members of the species.
